quotes.t: Hamilton thought the bank was a fait accompli, but he had not reckoned on Thomas Jefferson and James Madison. Jefferson, the lover of rural virtues, had a deep, almost visceral hatred of banks, the {qword}epitome{/qword} of all that was urban.

I didn't tell him that, at the time, I thought the place to be the {qword}epitome{/qword} of bourgeois comfort; in those days I thought that there was some connection between creative talent and penury.
Terns, nicknamed sea swallows by fishermen, are superb flying machines, the {qword}epitome{/qword} of beauty on the wing.
Manchester, then known as 'Cottonopolis' and perceived throughout the world as the {qword}epitome{/qword} of the whirling fierceness of the industrial revolution.  …
